intro: Cleome trachycarpa, commonly known as the roughleaf cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cleome trachycarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of growth. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
